active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a debate format, argue whether the performance benefits of caching and temporary storage outweigh the security risks in high-stakes environments like healthcare. Support your position with specific NIST SP 800-53 controls (e.g., SC-4, AC-12) and real-world examples of data leaks from poor temporary storage practices.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Asset Security domain. Topic: Temporary Storage Controls (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Information and Asset Classification > Asset Handling Requirements > Storage Requirements > Temporary Storage Controls). Use the provided research context: Core concepts (data in use, volatile memory, temporary files, cache, session data); NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 controls (AC-12 Session Termination, SC-4 Information in Shared Resources, MP-6 Media Sanitization, SC-28 Secure Cryptographic Key Support); NIST SP 800-171 Rev. 3 (Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information); best practices (auto-deletion, memory scrubbing, encryption). Sources: NIST SP 800-53r5 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-53r5, 2020); NIST SP 800-171r3 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-171r3, 2024). Incorporate university pedagogy: Align flashcards to these SMART learning objectives [insert full list above]. Structure content across 4 scaffolding layers [insert full layers above]. Infuse active learning elements (e.g., scenario prompts from discussion/problem-solving). Generate flashcards following EXACT schema [insert full schema above]. Ensure progressive difficulty (foundation to integration), link to prior knowledge (data classification/states), and high voter consensus (84.3%) on NIST focus. Output ONLY a JSON array of 50 flashcards, each as an object with keys: front, back, explanation, bloom_level, type, references. No additional text.
